content.title: Biofilm Management in Chronic Wounds
content.description: Recognition and treatment of bacterial biofilms in chronic wounds

key_concepts.details: Organized bacterial communities encased in extracellular polymeric substance (EPS)
Recalcitrant wound, slough despite debridement, increased exudate, failure to respond to antibiotics
Sharp debridement, surfactant-based cleansers, antimicrobial dressings
Biofilm reforms within 24-48 hours; requires ongoing disruption strategy

content.clinical_significance: Biofilm present in estimated 60-80% of chronic wounds
content.statement: Biofilm Management in Chronic Wounds is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Wound-Care that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
